comment.author: 22694125@N02
comment._content: Congratulations! This is a wonderful shot! You are invited to post it to: artland

comment.author: 87228992@N00
comment._content: Amazing thing. the train in the bearing is the famous UP M10000 of course. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M-10000 I suppose this train was equipped with these SKF bearings. The M10000 was quite revolutionary in the 1930's with the airstream styling heavily influenced by airplanes and cars from that time. Where is it from?

comment.author: 41131493@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/cklx] Thanks for your interest in the photograph! Unfortunately, we have very little data as to where this photograph was taken. Based on what we were able to find, SKF supplied the Union Pacific Railroad with wheelsets, traction motors, and gearbox bearings for their trains during the 1930s. Given that the M-10000 model appears in two other photographs within our collection, both associated with SKF, it is likely this was a display model that was in SKF's possession for their contribution on the full-sized M-10000. Given that the M-10000 was delivered to the railroad in 1934, it is likely that this photograph was taken around that time-period, to help promote SFK bearings, piggybacking off of the publicity of the locomotive. That's about everything I've been able to find. Thanks again for your interest!
